item.title: âœ… Week Two Recap
item.description:
Week Kickoff

The second week started with an exciting twist - I got invited to join a university computer vision project team! This is a perfect opportunity to apply my knowledge in practice.

Academic Progress

The algorithms course became significantly more challenging, but consequently more engaging. I particularly enjoyed the neural network optimization task - spent two evenings on it but achieved a 15% performance boost. The professor recognized my solution as one of the best in our group.

Research Work

Began data collection for my natural language processing research. Simultaneously assisting grad students with statistical data visualization. It’s fascinating how programming skills apply across such different domains!

Balance & Plans

  1. Completed 8 lab assignments (4 remaining)
  2. Got selected for a summer internship at an IT company
  3. Launched a technical blog documenting my projects
  4. Registered for the university hackathon

Despite the workload, I feel inspired by these new opportunities. The key is remembering to take breaks and occasionally step outside the dorm for fresh air!

item.title: Week Three Breakthrough Discoveries
item.description:
Discovery Week

  1. Had an OOP epiphany - polymorphism finally “clicked” after three weeks!
  2. Refactored my Python pet-project architecture applying these new insights
  3. Mastered Git CLI (previously only used GUI clients)
  4. Participated in university code review - received valuable feedback on my implementation
  5. Discovered the Pomodoro technique - 25-minute focused sprints work wonders!

Weekly Takeaways

Despite exhaustion from numerous labs, I’m seeing tangible progress. What excites me most is recognizing programming patterns - concepts that seemed like magic now follow logical structures. The key is maintaining balance: systematic learning with intentional breaks.

P.S. Found my best solutions emerge during evening walks near the dorm - quirky but true!
